  sgcool_label_text: This panoramic painting is one of the earliest views of the Shanghai Bund. From the buildings visible
 it has been dated to between 1849 and 1851. The artist included several landmarks
 among them the first European-style buildings in the settlement and the Chinese Custom House. In the foreground
 boats take part in a regatta.  \r\n\r\nAs Shanghai grew in stature as a British and European settlement
 paintings like this were important records of the development of the port and the increasing volume of international ships in the harbour. The city became a gateway for interactions between East and West.\r\n

metadata.title_text: View Of The Bund With A Regatta In Progress, Shanghai, 1849–51
metadata.physical_appearance: This is an oil on canvas panoramic painting of the view of the Bund in Shanghai. A row of Western architecture buildings (including a Chinese-roofed building) line the river bank, and a regatta is depicted in the foreground.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Russell & Co. Commercial buildings China trade painting Panoramas Regattas Shanghai (China) Jardine, Matheson & Co.
metadata.subject_terms_3: Commercial buildings Visual Arts Oil painting Rowing
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This panoramic painting is one of the earliest views of the Shanghai Bund. From the buildings visible, it has been dated to between 1849 and 1851. The artist included several landmarks, among them the first European-style buildings in the settlement and the Chinese Custom House. In the foreground, boats take part in a regatta.  

As Shanghai grew in stature as a British and European settlement, paintings like this were important records of the development of the port and the increasing volume of international ships in the harbour. The city became a gateway for interactions between East and West.
